Once, the north wind and the sun were arguing about whose power was greater. As they were arguing, a traveler passed by, wearing a thick coat. The two of them agreed that whoever could first get the traveler to take off his coat would be declared to have the greater power.

The north wind exerted all his strength and blew with all his might, but the harder he blew, the tighter the traveler wrapped his coat. Finally, the north wind was powerless and had no choice but to go up and immediately take off the coat himself.

Therefore, the north wind had to admit that the sun’s power was greater than his.

On one occasion, the North Wind and the Sun were arguing about whose power was greater. As they were arguing, a traveler passed by, wearing a thick coat. The two of them agreed that whoever could first make the traveler remove his coat would be deemed to have the greater power. The North Wind mustered all its strength and blew with all its might, but the harder it blew, the tighter the traveler wrapped his coat around himself. Finally, the North Wind was powerless and conceded. Then the Sun came out and shone, and the traveler immediately took off his coat. Therefore, the North Wind had to admit that the Sun’s power was greater than its own.
